snippet: For some of us, the apparent perfect symmetry of nature suggests an inventor. But evolution is messier and more roughshod than our own machines.
abstract: George Johnson Raw Data column traces humankind's history of assuming that intricate structures of nature could only have been made by sentient creator, when in fact such complexity is result of evolutionary trial and error; notes both awe inspired by depiction of AIDS virus and 1802 William Paley book Natural Theology: or Evidences of the Existence and Attributes of the Deity.
lead_paragraph: For some of us, the apparent perfect symmetry of nature suggests an inventor. But evolution is messier and more roughshod than our own machines.

headline.print_headline: Creation, in the Eye of the Beholder
headline.main: Creation, in the Eye of the Beholder
